events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 28th, resulting in damages to both the front bumper and windshield.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying the details related to the vehicle collision and damage type.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle further communications and assist with claim processing.
The claimant was sent an acknowledgment confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining the next steps.
The insurer requested copies of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from the claimant.
All requested documents including police report, repair quotes, and photographs of the accident scene were submitted by the customer.
The investigation team began evaluating the details of the collision, assessing liability, and verifying submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault, with damages fully substantiated by the collected evidence.
A settlement offer was made to cover repair costs and additional expenses incurred due to the vehicle accident.
The customer expressed gratitude for the prompt handling and fair offer provided following the vehicle collision claim.
Official approval of the claim was granted, allowing the insurance company to proceed with payment for the covered damages.
Payment for approved repairs and associated expenses was issued to the policyholderâ€™s account as agreed.
The claim file was closed after all obligations were met and the customer confirmed satisfaction with the settlement.
The entire claim documentation and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and audit purposes.
